queries: Appears to be ASL loan sign, but interestingly some Auslan signers interpret it as 'wrong' initialised for 'e' and sign it lower in space.
verbLexeme: 1. Of a person, to be very bad and to enjoy doing things that harm other people. English = (be) evil.
2. Of actions, to cause a great deal of harm to people. English = (be) evil.
nominalLexeme: 1. All the wicked and bad things that happen in the world. English = evil.
